User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user account within the JusHostIt platform. This document is lightweight and primarily for auth context.

displayName.description: The user's display name or full name.

photoURL.description: URL of the user's profile photo.

orgId.description: The ID of the organization this user belongs to.

role.description: The user's role within their organization.

Organization.title: Organization
Organization.description: Represents an organization or company, which is the root for all resources like sites and members. All billing and usage is tied to this entity.

ownerUid.description: The UID of the user who owns the organization.

stripeCustomerId.description: The customer ID from Stripe for billing.

subscriptionId.description: The ID of the active Stripe subscription.

currentPeriodEnd.description: Timestamp for when the current Stripe billing period ends.

gracePeriodEndsAt.description: If status is past_due, this is when access will be revoked.

OrgMember.title: OrgMember
OrgMember.description: Represents a user's membership and role within an organization. ID is a composite key for fast lookups.

email.description: Denormalized email of the user for easy lookup.

OrgUsage.title: OrgUsage
OrgUsage.description: Tracks pooled resource usage for an entire organization for the current billing period.

OrgInvitation.title: OrgInvitation
OrgInvitation.description: Represents an invitation for a user to join an organization.

Site.title: Site
Site.description: Represents a website hosted on the JusHostIt platform, owned by an organization.

Mail.title: Mail
Mail.description: Represents an email to be sent by the Trigger Email Firebase Extension.

definition.description: Stores user profile information and their current organization context (orgId, role). Writable only by the user themselves or by trusted server processes.
Root document for an organization. Contains billing status, plan, and other metadata. Writable only by trusted server processes (e.g., Stripe webhook).
A flat collection for scalable role lookups. The ID is a composite key: {orgId}_{uid}. This enables security rules to quickly check a user's role within any organization.
Stores pooled usage metrics for an organization. Writable only by trusted server processes.
Stores website information, nested under the owning organization.
Stores pending invitations for users to join an organization. Documents can be cleaned up after they are accepted or expire.
Collection for the Trigger Email extension. Authenticated users can create documents here to send emails.

firestore.reasoning: This data model is designed for a multi-tenant SaaS application with role-based access control (RBAC). The key decision is the separation of Users from Organizations. An `Organization` is the tenant that owns resources and is the source of truth for billing and plan limits. A `User` is a global entity representing an authenticated identity, with a lightweight document containing their org context. The flat `orgMembers` collection acts as a mapping table for efficient permission checks, and `orgUsage` provides a single document for atomic, pooled usage tracking. The `mail` collection is added for the Trigger Email extension.
